It will be a local holiday for the government departments and educational institutions on March 7 on account of the car festival at Sri Muthumariamman temple at Tiruvappur near here. In a release issued here on Friday, S. Ganesh, Collector, said that March 19 will be compensatory working day.

Patta transfer programme

Web-based patta transfer programme has been introduced in eleven taluks of Gandarvakottai, Ponnamaravathy, Avudaiyarkovil, Karambakudi, Manamelkudi, Pudukottai, Tirumayam, Aranthangi, Alangudi, Kulathur and Iluppur. A release issued here on Friday said that villagers and farmers in need of patta transfer could submit their applications online.

ATM opened

at HPO

Automated Teller Machine (ATM) service was opened at the Head post office in Sirkali on Friday. Duraisamy, Superintendent of Post Offices, inaugurated the service. Jayachandran, Post Master, gave away the ATM cards to the account-holders.

Road roko over halting distribution of relief

Members of families who were displaced from the Sri Nalankulam tank area near Sri Dharbaranyeswarar temple at Tirunallar resorted to ‘road roko’ stir on Puliyankottai Salai blocking vehicular traffic between Karaikal and Tirunallar for a while on Friday.

According to police, the members had gathered at the Slum Clearance Board for getting cheques towards compensation for their eviction from their huts in the tank area for providing infrastructure under the Tirunallar Temple Town Development Programme. Although cheques were issued to 10 displaced families in the morning, officials refused to issue the cheques to the balance 38 families in the afternoon in the wake of model code of conduct.

Police held talks with the displaced persons and pacified them following which they dispersed.
title: Local holiday for car festival
